image.altText: An artistic impression of Snowtown, including its "welcome" sign and former bank vault.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most notorious serial killers — "bodies-in-the-barrels" murderer James Vlassakis — has been approved for release from prison after 26 years. Here's a look at what happens now.

title.children: The youngest of the Snowtown killers has been granted parole. Here's what we know

image.altText: Police officers carry evidence bags.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Police Commissioner says he has not yet made a decision on whether to challenge the parole of Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis — but former top prosecutor Stephen Pallaras says he is "astonished" the parole board "would even consider" releasing him.

title.children: Former DPP 'astonished' parole granted to Snowtown killer James Vlassakis

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas holding a piece of metal.

props.synopsis: Australian smelters are competing with Chinese companies that are "bigger, faster, better and cheaper". So, is the federal government right to keep the local industry afloat?

title.children: Risky bailout or smart geopolitics? The $135m smelter rescue divides opinion

image.altText: A woman in a cream woollen jumper and blue jeans stands at a railing with a younger woman in a cap and vest.

props.synopsis: Despite battling the drought herself, South Australian farmer Bridget Woods dipped into her own superannuation to buy fodder in bulk for others in her community who are struggling to feed livestock.

title.children: Farmer dips into her super to buy fodder in bulk for drought-hit community

image.altText: Old industrial buildings in a green landscape.

props.synopsis: Long-term volunteers from the heritage conservation group are refusing to pay a controversial "service fee" to headquarters, arguing the money should be invested in historic South Australian properties.

title.children: National Trust SA branches refuse HQ's fee while struggling with costs

image.altText: Inside the historical Mortlock Wing of the State Library of South Australia.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's premier library has been recognised by the 1000 Libraries Awards as second most beautiful in the world, while Victoria has snagged seventh spot.

title.children: The Australian libraries among top 10 most beautiful in the world

image.altText: Travis Boak celebrates by punching his right fist in the air and yelling with delight to the crowd

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide great, and three-time All-Australian, Travis Boak has announced his retirement from the AFL

title.children: Port Adelaide great Travis Boak announces retirement from AFL

image.altText: Police tape at the front of a brick hosue

props.synopsis: Johnathon Malcolm Goodfellow, who killed a father by stabbing him in the chest in Adelaide's northern suburbs two years ago, has been sentenced to at least eight years behind bars.

title.children: Man jailed for fatal stabbing amid motorcycle dispute

image.altText: Adelaide Oval with the River Torrens and the pedestrian bridge with green signage on it

props.synopsis: Adelaide's River Torrens has battled pollution and an image problem over the decades — but there is now a proposal to bring back swimming to the waterway.

title.children: The River Torrens has battled pollution — can it be safe for swimming?

image.altText: cars splash water over the road as pedestrians try cross flooded roads and footpaths

props.synopsis: A wet finish to the year is increasingly favoured across Australia as a major climate driver emerges for the first time in three years.

title.children: Major climate driver signals wet end to the year

image.altText: Man carries young person on his back in front of building destroyed in earthquake

props.synopsis: In Indonesia, activists who recently won a court ruling requiring mandatory labelling on asbestos products are now being sued for defamation by a global industry lobby group representing the world's biggest asbestos producers, including those in Russia and China.

title.children: Australia banned asbestos 20 years ago, but a new battle is raging next door

image.altText: the exterior of a court house

props.synopsis: A children's court has heard a 13-year-old study tour student charged with the murder of a 14-year-old near Newcastle may have been "disassociated and psychotic" at the time of the alleged stabbing.

title.children: Case of 13yo Chinese student accused of murder 'complex', court hears

image.altText: A mosquito on the skin of a person.

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to stop the spread of the disease in Southern China, with similar measures to those taken during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: What to know about chikungunya as cases rise in South China

image.altText: Four divers in wetsuits and life jackets walking out of rushing water over a flooded road.

props.synopsis: Police confirm they have found a body believed to be a 26-year-old Chinese woman who was swept into floodwaters in NSW Hunter region over the weekend.

title.children: Body found in search for woman swept away by floodwaters

image.altText: A cllose-up shot of the front wheels and decks of some e-scooters in Perth.

props.synopsis: The regulation of e-bikes and e-scooters is under the spotlight at a WA parliamentary inquiry, which has heard calls for tougher rules around their sale and testimony from trauma doctors.

title.children: Men, teens bearing brunt of serious e-rideable injuries, surgeon tells inquiry

image.altText: A man with a beard and black cap stands in the framework of a house construction site.

props.synopsis: A WA resident who was lucky to escape an electrical blaze is building his new home with a fireproof space dedicated to charging devices, amid debate about safe battery storage and disposal.

title.children: Man who lost home in battery fire takes safety into his own hands

image.altText: A phot of a man and woman with party hats on stuck in a photo album.

props.synopsis: An inquest into the death of Sheila Thurlow, who was given a lethal dose of morphine at a Brisbane hospital in June 2022, has heard from the nurse who drew up the dose.

title.children: Nurse who drew up lethal morphine dose apologises to woman's family

image.altText: An external view of the Magistrates Court in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Patricia Iliev had not received medical attention since 1988 and was severely emaciated when she died in March 2021. A coronial inquest has found her long-term partner did not have any malicious intent.

title.children: A Tasmanian woman who declined medical attention for 30 years died of starvation

image.altText: Ed Langdon and Jack Viney

props.synopsis: Ed Langdon says Simon Goodwin still has the love and respect of Melbourne's players despite president Brad Green's claims they needed a new voice as coach.

title.children: Langdon hits back at president's claims Dees players needed 'new voice'

image.altText: Penrith Panthers coach Ivan Cleary looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Panthers coach Ivan Cleary comes to the defence of under-fire trainer Corey Bocking after he receives a five-match suspension by the NRL for running in front of Jayden Campbell.

title.children: Cleary slams 'excessive' NRL suspension of 'struggling' Panthers trainer

image.altText: Jamie Lee Curtis wearing a blue dress, Lindsay Lohan in black, both in sunnies in front of the opera house

props.synopsis: Jamie Lee Curtis and Lindsay Lohan attend the Sydney premiere of Freakier Friday at Bondi Junction as part of their global promotional tour of the sequel to the 2003 Disney hit Freaky Friday.

title.children: Curtis and Lohan strut Sydney's purple carpet for Freakier Friday premiere

image.altText: Five vials containing a yellow liquid

props.synopsis: A Sydney man is the first person in Australia to be charged with supplying a potentially lethal nitazene-laced vape liquid in a "disturbing evolution" in the illicit drug trade.

title.children: Opioid found in vape liquid hundreds of times more potent than heroin

image.altText: A crowd holds up an array of home made signs

props.synopsis: Today's strike action was expected to affect more than half a million students at about 1,200 state schools.

title.children: Queensland teachers striking over 'pretty dire situation'

image.altText: Gareth ward pic day 2

props.synopsis: Lawyers for convicted sex offender Gareth Ward have argued his expulsion from NSW Parliament pending appeals would be an "affront" to representative democracy, according to court documents.

title.children: Lawyers for sex offender MP argue expulsion would be an 'affront'

image.altText: A man in a tuxedo and woman in pink dress smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A man accused of drowning his wife and staging it as a kayaking accident allegedly had "prominent" and "obvious" inconsistencies in his version of events, a court has heard.

title.children: Man accused of wife's murder had 'inconsistencies' in story, court hears

image.altText: A builder with a hammer

props.synopsis: New home approvals are accelerating as the federal government pushes its signature housing policy, but construction industry leaders and analysts worry we will never have the tradies to build them.

title.children: Industry says housing crisis is morphing into a construction crisis

image.altText: A close up shot of a man in a white shirt and silver tie, with a woman walking beside him.

props.synopsis: The criminal trial of Matt Wright kicked off in the NT Supreme Court today with the prosecution laying out its case. The celebrity crocodile wrangler is facing charges of attempting to pervert the course of justice concerning a fatal chopper crash in 2022.

title.children: Crown lays out Netflix star Matt Wright's alleged 'cover-up' — as it happened

image.altText: Wallaroos player Charlotte Caslick is sitting down while a physio examines her ankle. She has a pained expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Charlotte Caslick is one of the all-time greats of rugby sevens and now she's hoping to make a swift comeback from ankle surgery, to play in her first Women's Rugby World Cup.

title.children: Sevens star Caslick hoping to defy odds and realise Rugby World Cup dream

image.altText: A group of people on the beach helping overturn a capsized speedboat

props.synopsis: A speedboat travelling from Nusa Penida to Bali has capsized after being struck by large waves, killing two people and leaving one missing.

title.children: Five Australians among 80 on boat that capsized in Bali

image.altText: Jim Chalmers img

props.synopsis: Productivity is an economic concept, but it should be fired by the universal human experience of being driven mad by unnecessary stuff that makes life harder.

title.children: Productivity starts in our kitchens and at the school gate

image.altText: A National Capital Authority blue sign on a building site marking the planned future location for a Russian Embassy.

props.synopsis: Australia passed a law in 2023 cancelling Russia's lease for a planned embassy near Parliament House, but Russia is now disputing that in the High Court.

title.children: Russia takes Australia to High Court over cancelled lease

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit, red tie and white top waving with his right hand and appearing emotionless on an airport tarmac

props.synopsis: Just as happened with the Supreme Court in the legal sphere, the United States president has the opportunity to shape — and possibly distort — America's economic institutions.

title.children: Trump leads attack on institutions underpinning the US economy

image.altText: A redheaded man with a cropped beard walks past a brick-walled building

props.synopsis: The UK-based Charity Commission has cleared Prince Harry of bullying the chairperson of a charity he co-founded.

title.children: Prince Harry cleared of bullying charity boss

image.altText: A big black bull with a red, blue and white ribbon is held by a woman.

props.synopsis: A 1,356-kilogram Angus bull has won the title of heaviest bull on the grounds at this year's Ekka in Brisbane. But he's not the biggest ever.

title.children: 1.3-tonne Buster the bull turning heads at big ag shows
